intro: Leucanthemopsis boissieri, commonly known as the rock dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its basal rosette of gray-green, hairy leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant is typically found in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its flowers are composed of ray florets surrounding a central disc, typical of the Asteraceae family. Leucanthemopsis boissieri is often used in rock gardens due to its ornamental value and low maintenance requirements.
